topic.title: Is it possible to move the storage folder off the drive zeronet was originally installed with?
topic.body: I can't figure out how to tell it to store files on a different disk because the  one for my programs is not intended for data storage, it's too small.

1574434941_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
> [azzzzzz](#comment_2_1JYuNAwYAcQXhGRZKMGFGgBvvFi6F9yC7m):  ━ 2 days ago ^2 ^3
Reply
⋮

nothing is supposed to be or do anything. everything just is and does, retard. the internet is a lot like nature, there is no stopping it

Good to be on board with the internet, I'm working to seed the zeronet like a digital pimp son.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gmqwn4Gx_fw

1574529308_1MFJwynRwEkS2vHr8BH21DjDBEXcb.body: Iran needs what we're doing with zeronet very badly... Good on you.

1572478148_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
> [peppermintswirl](#comment_16_123mMiSRJ2T5wrMtS9Ub8rKvPTRcTjVSTx): I think it honestly depends. We should be welcoming newcomers slowly and carefully. If there are too many, especially with the common culture being the way it is, it'll have the opposite effect one might expect

part of the whole intent of this code is that  you cannot actually keep anyone who wants to be here out. That's part of what it was protesting. There's no way to curate people.

I have to disagree pasionately with that.  The whole point of Zeronet in a way is that Societies should and ought to be governed from the grassroots.
I'm a grassroots supporter.  I was part of the Silkroad before the FBI raids and Aware of Cryptocurrency and was just waiting for something like this and then recently on Torrentfreak it was mentioned again by Travis.
The users make the community what it is, all the devs do is facilitate the conversation.

1574709000_17HiBFxSUskJt5VznGAVq8bxsqqkj.body:
> [fractalzoomer](#comment_25_1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYEKgAFj): In the file zeronet.conf (either at /etc/zeronet.conf or in the ZeroNet-py3 directory), changedata_dir = (default directory)todata_dir = (your directory here)and move everything to the new directory.

> [fractalzoomer](#comment_25_1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYEKgAFj): In the file zeronet.conf (either at /etc/zeronet.conf or in the ZeroNet-py3 directory), changedata_dir = (default directory)todata_dir = (your directory here)and move everything to the new directory.

Should have specified I'm on windows...  Although I have a linux box. maybe I should use it on here.

> [fractalzoomer](#comment_26_1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYEKgAFj): I don't know where zeronet.conf is on windows, maybe do some digging around on your system or ask someone else.

It's cool.  I just moved the whole operation to D because it doesn't use the conf file on here.  it worked

Also > [fractalzoomer](#comment_26_1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYEKgAFj): I don't know where zeronet.conf is on windows, maybe do some digging around on your system or ask someone else.

Also you and menotyou  reminded me of why I'm learning Linux beyond the basic commandline now.

Because The community is helpful and much more eager to help others who have earnestly tried and put in effort.
